string-array.name: health_messages
string-array.item: Regular exercise can help regulate blood sugar levels and improve insulin sensitivity.
A 1% reduction in A1C can reduce diabetes-related complications by 21%.
Drinking water helps your kidneys flush out excess blood sugar through urine.
Stress hormones can raise blood sugar levels even without eating.
Getting 7-9 hours of sleep helps regulate insulin sensitivity.
Fiber slows down digestion and helps prevent blood sugar spikes.
Regular foot checks can prevent serious complications from unnoticed injuries.
Monitoring blood pressure is crucial as diabetes increases heart disease risk.
Eating protein with carbs can help slow down glucose absorption.
Cinnamon may help improve insulin sensitivity naturally.
Regular eye exams can detect early signs of diabetic retinopathy.
Walking for 10 minutes after meals can lower blood sugar levels.
Magnesium-rich foods can help improve insulin function.
Apple cider vinegar before meals may reduce post-meal blood sugar spikes.
Berries have a low glycemic index and are rich in antioxidants.
Morning blood sugar tends to be higher due to the dawn phenomenon.
Regular dental check-ups help prevent diabetes-related gum disease.
Staying hydrated helps your body use insulin more effectively.
Cold temperatures can affect blood glucose meter accuracy.
Smoking can increase insulin resistance and diabetes complications.

string-array.name: fact_messages
string-array.item: Always rotate injection sites to prevent lipohypertrophy.
Store insulin in the refrigerator between 36-46°F (2-8°C).
Don\'t shake insulin vials vigorously; roll them gently.
Test strips should be stored in their original container.
Clean the injection site with alcohol and let it dry completely.
Replace lancets daily for accurate readings and comfort.
Keep glucose tablets or gel readily available for emergencies.
Check blood sugar before driving for safety.
Log your readings to track patterns and trends.
Don\'t store insulin near freezer compartments.
Inspect insulin for changes in color or clarity.
Keep testing supplies at room temperature for accuracy.
Replace your glucose meter every 2-3 years.
Don\'t share blood glucose monitoring devices.
Check expiration dates on all diabetes supplies.
Carry medical ID indicating you have diabetes.
Keep a glucagon kit accessible to family members.
Test blood sugar before and after exercise.
Don\'t reuse insulin syringes or pen needles.
Store test strips away from heat and humidity.

string-array.name: scary_messages
string-array.item: Diabetes is the leading cause of non-traumatic lower limb amputations.
Every 30 seconds, someone loses a limb due to diabetes complications.
Diabetic retinopathy causes 12,000-24,000 new cases of blindness yearly.
Uncontrolled diabetes increases heart attack risk by 400%.
70% of diabetics develop nerve damage over time.
Diabetes doubles the risk of developing depression.
Diabetics have 2.3x higher risk of liver disease.
30% of diabetics will develop kidney disease.
Diabetes increases the risk of stroke by 150%.
50% of diabetics die of cardiovascular disease.
Uncontrolled diabetes can lead to permanent nerve damage.
Diabetes-related wounds have a 15% amputation rate.
High blood sugar can cause permanent brain damage.
Diabetics have 3x higher risk of periodontal disease.
25% of diabetics develop foot ulcers.
Diabetes can reduce life expectancy by up to 10 years.
60% of diabetics develop high blood pressure.
Uncontrolled diabetes can lead to permanent vision loss.
Diabetes increases infection risk by 50%.
Diabetic coma can occur within hours of high blood sugar.
